summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) daily log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 9, 2019. It records inmate movements, administrative changes, and transfers, including the entry for Jeffrey Epstein (REG NO 76309-054) showing a 'PRE REMOVE' action from cell E02-513u to G10-7781. This log captures activity on the day Epstein was found deceased in his cell.

events.title: Inmate Movements and Administrative Changes at MCC New York
events.description: The Bureau of Prisons daily log records numerous inmate movements, administrative changes ('ADM CHANGE'), releases ('RELEASE', 'FT REL'), bail/bond postings, hospital transfers ('HOSP USM'), treaty transfers ('TRTY TRANS'), and preparatory removal actions ('PRE REMOVE') within the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York (implied by facility code 'NYM')
keyFacts: This is an official Bureau of Prisons (BOP) daily operational log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 9, 2019.

The log meticulously records inmate movements between cells, administrative status changes, releases, bail postings, and preparatory removals ('PRE REMOVE'), providing a snapshot of facility operations.

The document is part of the Epstein case files, and its date (August 9, 2019) corresponds to the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the same facility, though his name does not appear in this extracted segment.
The log entries are generated by prison staff (identified by TID codes like NYMH3, NYMGZ) and track the precise time of each action.
The document demonstrates the standard, high-volume administrative tracking within a federal detention facility.
